FIXED: Stream length of AES encrypted streams as suggested by Rüdiger Politzer on the mailinglist.Hello Dom Im testing the (buggy) AES encryption implementation of libpodofo and I hope that I detected the error!The solution is that the length of the encrypted object streams has to be adapted. That means that not the original stream length should be written in the encrypted pdfbut the new stream length (including padding and initial vector)..You get this new length by calling the CalculateStreamLength() function of the PdfEncryptAESclass. My (dirty) solution is to extend the PdfEncrypt class with functions to set marker for object streams andobject stream length in case of AES encryption. First I set the object stream marker in PdfObject::WriteObject() incase of object streams and second the object stream length marker in PdfDictionary::Write(..).So I got all my information and when writting the value of the object stream length in PdfVariant::Write()I check for object stream (and AES encryption) and adjust the stream length. I know that this is certainly a dirty solution but it works and I got aes-128bit encrypted pdfs. I hope that with this information the AES encryption bug could be fixed in a future version of thepodofo library. I you want more information or my patches just send me an email. Best regardsRüdigergit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1293 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

I finally found time for some refactoring of the font subsystem. The cluttered PdfFontMetrics class annoyed me for some time and the handling of Base14 fonts did not improve the situation.Therefore PdfFontMetrics is now an interface with 3 concrete baseclasses:* PdfFontMetricsFreetype - basically the old PdfFontMetrics class which reads font metrics information using freetype* PdfFontMetricsBase14 - implementation that uses the static information we have about the standard Base14 fonts* PdfFontMetricsObject - tries to get all information from a font descriptor object in the PDF (uncomplete implementation)git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1242 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Commited a large patch contributed by Ian Currington which makes PoDoFo 64bit safe. He was able to edit a 5GB PDF file in one test.Citing from his email:Today after several months of developmentwe are able to contribute a new set of changes to PoDoFo.These are specifically about 64-bit porting. As you can imagine thechanges are widespread with data type changes.To enable you do perform difference analysis the changes are againstSVN 990. The changes dramatically reduce cast and data type warningson MS Visual Studio C++ x64. The changes have been tested internallyhere on 4 or 5 machines including Linux 32-bit Linux 64-bit andVista 64 Visual Studio 2008 x64.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1005 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

PdfStreamedDocument works now replacing the WriteImmediate stuff in PdfDocument. PdfImages and annotations wont work yet with PdfDocument. The filters have precedence now though.Additionally I fixed a crash in PdfOutlines and PdfDocument::Append merges now the outline structure of both documents correctly. I was able to append the PDFReference16.pdf to Apples ObjectiveCbook to obtain a 1500 pages PDF file. The merge was successfull only named destinations do not work in the merged PDF as nametrees are not yet merged.To make PdfDocument::Append working operator= had to be implemented for PdfStream.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@411 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: helloworld example. I think it is better to maintain examples in the main tree so that they get updated along with the main sources. Also they can be included in the API documentation much easier this way. More examples will come in the future :)FIXED: PdfDocument::Append does now append streams correctly (PdfStream::operator= uses SetRawData now)FIXED: PdfVecObjects is now a sorted vector. This changed required that it is not public accessible as vector but only trough PdfVecObjects interface. This might require some changes in PoDoFoBrowser I did not yet look into it but will do so!BUT!!!! This change is worth some work! :) Mergint the PdfReference.pdf and Apples Objective C Manuel with podofomerge takes now 55seconds ibstead of 7minutes on my system! 700% performance boost thanks to binary searching :). PoDoFoBrowser will also benefit from this change.I will do some further testing and some more performance tweaking bug fixing over the next week.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@478 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: Patch by Uli Arnold who added color separationHis description of the patch (sorry german only - I am not in the mood to translate right now just came back from a conference) Anbei wieder mal ein Patch für PoDoFo. Ich habe die Separation-Colors (Spotbzw. Volltonfarben) implementiert. Man kann jetzt mittels eines neuenPdfColor-ctors mit bool-Argument die SeparationColor All bzw. None anlegen.All erscheint auf sämtlichen Farbauszügen (z.B. für Passermarken) Noneerscheint nirgends. Ein weiterer ctor mit Name und cmyk-Args legt eineSeparation-Color mit diesem Namen und den entsprechenden cmyk-Ersatzwertenan. Diese Farbe erscheint dann auf dem RIP bzw. bei Acrobat unterErweitert/Druckproduktion/Ausgabevorschau als separater Auszug zusätzlich zuCMYK. Die Änderungen im einzelnen:*       PdfColor.h/cpp:    Neuer ctor für ColorAll und ColorNone sowie fürSpotfarbe mit Ersatz-CMYK*       PdfDefines.h:       Neuer enum ePdfColorSpace_Separation*       PdfCanvas.h/cpp: Neue Memberfunktion AddColorResource welche denColorSpace inklusive Tint-Funktion zu der übergebenen PdfColor in denResourcen der PdfPage bzw. des PdfXObject anlegt.*       PdfPainter.h/cpp:  Logik für m_curColor angepasst InSetStrokingColor und SetColor den neuen ColorSpace befehlen mitautomatischem Eintragen in die Resourcen des Canvasgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@992 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

If the /Size key is missing from the trailer dictionary treat the xref size asunknown and expand the xref table as each xref section is read. Log a complaintabout a standards violation too.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@788 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: PoDoFo writes correct XRef tables now in any case (in theory - read on). PoDoFo generated broken XRef tables in some cases because it was not able to correctly create the linked list of free objects over XRef subsections. This works now. A good test case is the PDFReference17.pdf and ParserTest. PoDoFo reads the file correctly and IMHO PoDoFos output is correct! Poppler does not report any errors Ghostscript does neither. Acrobat Reader 7.0.8 reports though that the XRef table is broken. I cannot figure out why because from my understanding it is correct. Any ideas?So writing XRef tables has improved but one problem remains with ./ParserTest PDFReference17.pdf output.pdf . FIXED: Improved code sharing between PdfXRef and PdfXRefStream thanks to a nicer interface. FIXED: PdfParser can now read PDF files with XRef Streams witch contain several XRef subsections in one stream.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@521 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Removed padding from PdfVariant. It was only used twice in PoDoFo and every PdfVariant had to carry the padding information. Padding is now done via the new class PdfData which allows to write raw data to a PDF file using PdfVariant. Fixed a major parser bug: The parser expected all objects inobject streams to be of type dictionary.The PDF reference PDF file is now parsed correctly. I will test this fix another day and release PoDoFo 0.4.0 on Sunday.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@261 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Finally the promissed commit with some refactoring:- A PdfObject contains now always excactly one PdfVariant.- The PdfVariant can be get and set with PdfObject::GetVariant and PdfObject::SetVariant- If the returned variant is a dictionary the overloaded methods AddKey HasKey RemoveKey will work on the PdfObject- You can also use PdfObject::GetVariant().GetDictionary() to get access to the contents of a dictionaryThis change required great refactoring in almost all areas of the source code. I hope I did not introduce any new bugs but all my tests worked. I think the change makes PoDoFo much more simple and will also increase PoDoFos performance once PdfVariant is implicitly shared.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@54 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Commited a large patch contributed by Ian Currington which makes PoDoFo 64bit safe. He was able to edit a 5GB PDF file in one test.Citing from his email:Today after several months of developmentwe are able to contribute a new set of changes to PoDoFo.These are specifically about 64-bit porting. As you can imagine thechanges are widespread with data type changes.To enable you do perform difference analysis the changes are againstSVN 990. The changes dramatically reduce cast and data type warningson MS Visual Studio C++ x64. The changes have been tested internallyhere on 4 or 5 machines including Linux 32-bit Linux 64-bit andVista 64 Visual Studio 2008 x64.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1005 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

PdfStreamedDocument works now replacing the WriteImmediate stuff in PdfDocument. PdfImages and annotations wont work yet with PdfDocument. The filters have precedence now though.Additionally I fixed a crash in PdfOutlines and PdfDocument::Append merges now the outline structure of both documents correctly. I was able to append the PDFReference16.pdf to Apples ObjectiveCbook to obtain a 1500 pages PDF file. The merge was successfull only named destinations do not work in the merged PDF as nametrees are not yet merged.To make PdfDocument::Append working operator= had to be implemented for PdfStream.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@411 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: helloworld example. I think it is better to maintain examples in the main tree so that they get updated along with the main sources. Also they can be included in the API documentation much easier this way. More examples will come in the future :)FIXED: PdfDocument::Append does now append streams correctly (PdfStream::operator= uses SetRawData now)FIXED: PdfVecObjects is now a sorted vector. This changed required that it is not public accessible as vector but only trough PdfVecObjects interface. This might require some changes in PoDoFoBrowser I did not yet look into it but will do so!BUT!!!! This change is worth some work! :) Mergint the PdfReference.pdf and Apples Objective C Manuel with podofomerge takes now 55seconds ibstead of 7minutes on my system! 700% performance boost thanks to binary searching :). PoDoFoBrowser will also benefit from this change.I will do some further testing and some more performance tweaking bug fixing over the next week.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@478 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: Patch by Uli Arnold who added color separationHis description of the patch (sorry german only - I am not in the mood to translate right now just came back from a conference) Anbei wieder mal ein Patch für PoDoFo. Ich habe die Separation-Colors (Spotbzw. Volltonfarben) implementiert. Man kann jetzt mittels eines neuenPdfColor-ctors mit bool-Argument die SeparationColor All bzw. None anlegen.All erscheint auf sämtlichen Farbauszügen (z.B. für Passermarken) Noneerscheint nirgends. Ein weiterer ctor mit Name und cmyk-Args legt eineSeparation-Color mit diesem Namen und den entsprechenden cmyk-Ersatzwertenan. Diese Farbe erscheint dann auf dem RIP bzw. bei Acrobat unterErweitert/Druckproduktion/Ausgabevorschau als separater Auszug zusätzlich zuCMYK. Die Änderungen im einzelnen:*       PdfColor.h/cpp:    Neuer ctor für ColorAll und ColorNone sowie fürSpotfarbe mit Ersatz-CMYK*       PdfDefines.h:       Neuer enum ePdfColorSpace_Separation*       PdfCanvas.h/cpp: Neue Memberfunktion AddColorResource welche denColorSpace inklusive Tint-Funktion zu der übergebenen PdfColor in denResourcen der PdfPage bzw. des PdfXObject anlegt.*       PdfPainter.h/cpp:  Logik für m_curColor angepasst InSetStrokingColor und SetColor den neuen ColorSpace befehlen mitautomatischem Eintragen in die Resourcen des Canvasgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@992 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Fixed a major parser bug: The parser expected all objects inobject streams to be of type dictionary.The PDF reference PDF file is now parsed correctly. I will test this fix another day and release PoDoFo 0.4.0 on Sunday.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@261 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Finally the promissed commit with some refactoring:- A PdfObject contains now always excactly one PdfVariant.- The PdfVariant can be get and set with PdfObject::GetVariant and PdfObject::SetVariant- If the returned variant is a dictionary the overloaded methods AddKey HasKey RemoveKey will work on the PdfObject- You can also use PdfObject::GetVariant().GetDictionary() to get access to the contents of a dictionaryThis change required great refactoring in almost all areas of the source code. I hope I did not introduce any new bugs but all my tests worked. I think the change makes PoDoFo much more simple and will also increase PoDoFos performance once PdfVariant is implicitly shared.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@54 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Patch by Jonathan Verner to optimize laoding of PDFs with object streams:when trying to use PoDoFo to parse large files (e.g. the PDF spec)PdfMemDocument took forever to load. When I tried running e.g.podofocountpages on the PDF spec after approx. ten minutes it wasntfinished yet.After looking at it I found out that most of the timeis spent in  PdfObjectStreamparserObject::ReadObjectsFromStreamin the while cycle.First on line 98 (PdfObjectStreamParserObject.cpp)GetObject is called. If the m_vecObjects vector is not sorted themethod first calls sort to sort it.Then on line 102 a new object is pushed_back into the vectorwhich invalidates the sorting so when GetObject is called againit has to sort the list again --- Quite time consuming.I have tried replacing the push_back on line 102 by a newmethod insert_sorted which inserts the element intothe vector so that it stays sorted (if it was sorted in the first place)and this has led to a dramatic improvement: now podofocountpagesfinishes in a reasonable amount of time:$ time podofocountpages PDF32000_2008.pdfPDF32000_2008.pdf:      756real    0m20.235suser    0m16.809ssys     0m0.260sAttached is my proposed patch. What do you think about it?git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1457 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: I have changed PdfFileInputStream to be able to return file pointer to under laying file. After that there is no need to open another stream to same image file. PdfFileInputStream will maintain object lifetime (FILE*) if there is exception raised from jpeg code. There is also a handler which should make jpeg lib more quiet.       Some PNG files can have alpha component for gray and RGB images. Also they may use indexed colors and without patch they will not render or load correctly. Changed the build system so that only one library is build. This reverts the previous change where PoDoFo was split into two libraries podofo-base and podofo-doc.Now there is only one library libpodofo.I reverted the change because of major linkage problems which caused for example crashes in PdfMemDocument. This and other reasons kept many people from switching to trunk and to the latest version of PoDoFo.These problem should all be gone and if you refused to upgrade it should be safe now.This is the basis for the upcoming PoDoFo 0.9.0 release which I intend to release next week.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1425 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: Mantis issue 0000015HeloI have small issue with class PdfDate and formatting of time zone. Im working on signing PDF and it also depends on correct date formatting.Problem with current impl:My local time is 10:34 am and I live in time zone GMT+1. Correct format of such time according PDF 1.7/3.8.3 Dates is: (D:201101261034+0100) but PoDoFo on Win32 generates: (D:201101261034-0100)Simple solution (PdfDate.cpp):- snprintf( szZone ZONE_STRING_SIZE %+03d _timezone/3600 );+ snprintf( szZone ZONE_STRING_SIZE %+03d -_timezone/3600 );Explanation:Definition from MSDN: _timezone = Difference in seconds between coordinated universal time and local time. The default value is 28800.For my example: 9:34 (GMT TIME) - 10:34 (local time)= -1h - but we have to store +1hThanksPetr Pytelkagit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1408 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: PdfVecObjects::CollectGarbage makes PoDoFos garbage collection for PDF files available through the public API.       It will deletes all objects that are not reachable via the trailer. I also added a small tool podofogc to try the garbage collection.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1403 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: Another patch by Johannes for the LZWDecoderHijust found one more bug in LZW decompression. With fix suggestion of course :-)File: PdfFiltersPrivate.cppBug: class PdfLZWFilter is unable to create 0xff bytes in decoded LZW streams. This is obviously not relevant for compressed text streams (99.9% of all cases) but is important when image data is LZW-encoded. (No one should use LZW on inlined image data nowadays but some strange workflow software still does.)Explanation: The current default decoding dictionary (created in PdfLZWFilter::InitTable) maps code:0xff to cleartext:<two bytes derived from an PdfLZWFilter constant>. Thus any (0*)-1111-1111 bit sequence in the LZW stream is decoded as two(!) bytes which is not correct: its impossible to create 0xff bytes in the output stream and the output data even may become longer as expected. Any n-bit-sequence s for which s==(s&0xff) holds should be an identity. Just the sequences where s!=(s&0xff) - where bit 9 (or any higher bit) is set - are codes for multibyte sequences.Suggested fix: the loop counter should run to (including!) 255 to form the completed identity function. To keep the table size after InitTable() exactly the same just one dummy entry is added (no content needed here: 0x100 is magic for clear dictionary - the encoder will never use this code as an abbreviation so this table entry value is never used: The entry is just for correct counting of the dictionary size).Changed code:-----X-----void PdfLZWFilter::InitTable(){    int      i;    TLzwItem item;    m_table.clear();    m_table.reserve( LZW_TABLE_SIZE );    for( i=0;i<=255;i++ )    {        item.value.clear();        item.value.push_back( static_cast<unsigned char>(i) );        m_table.push_back( item );    }    item.value.clear();    m_table.push_back( item );}-----X-----RegardsJohannesgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1296 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: Crash in LZWFilter thanks to Dr. Johannes Bitterling for the patch!Hi allIve just found a bug in PdfLZWFilter and (maybe) developed a suitable fix. Please verify before using it :-)Bug: parsing fails on some PDFs containing LZW-compressed streams (see also: Problem with /LZWDecode filter stream report as of of Fri 16 Apr 2010 10:02:06 -0700 this might solve the problem mentioned - had the same problem here).Suggested solution: in file PdfFiltersPrivate.cpp function PdfLZWFilter::DecodeBlockImpl just remove the case 4095:.Reasons: when the dictionary size reaches 4095 entries further incrementing m_mask will invariably lead to an out of bounds array access in s_masks[] (which has just four entries valid indices 0..3). - In addition at least the PDF files which I used for debugging do contain an PdfLZWFilter::s_clear as next opcode... but with unchanged m_code_len so incrementing m_code_len will lead to consumption of an additional input bit which will render the rest of the stream unreadable.RegardsJohannesgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1292 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Some major changes due to 2 regressions that made PDFReference17.pdf and PDFReference16.pdf unparsable for PoDoFo trunk.FIXED: PDFReference17.pdf can be parsed again in reasonable time. Adding entries to the list of free object is faster now. This is achieved by using binary search with equals_range instead of linear search and by using deque instead of list for faster insertions. PDFReference contains a few 10000 free objects.ADDED: PdfMemoryManagement.h podofo_malloc and podofo_free which should be used everywhere instead of malloc and free. This should allow windows users to free memory outside of PoDoFo which we allocated using malloc. Examples are allocations by PdfStream::GetFilteredCopy.REFACTORED: Extracted XRefStream parsing from PdfParser into an own object to make the parser less complex and hopefully fix parsing of PDFReference16.pdf object which still does not work.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1171 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: If PDF Stream writer writes an object (because stream data is appended) no key may be added to this object as all keys are already written and changes wont make it to the final PDF. Therefore certain order of calls to PoDoFo methods resulted in broken PDFs.PdfVariants are now set to immutable once they are written by PdfImmediateWriter and the PdfDataTypes throw an exception if they are changed after being set to immutable. There might be places in our current code where such problems might occur. We will have to fix them as they are detected. This caused the problems reported by Jörg Richter on the mailing list.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1160 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Make it safe to include PdfMutex.h without testing BUILDING_PODOFO  (if you include it and BUILDING_PODOFO is unset you just get a forward-decl)- Split PdfMutex into platform-specific implementations in separate files.  Each file provides an implementation of the class PdfMutexImpl which  is inherited by the trivial class PdfMutex. Its done this way so that  PdfMutex may later add non-platform-specific functionality if needed.  Platform separation into separate files is for readability and ease of  future porting.- Rework PdfMutex implementations to be header-only inline implementations.  Theres a *tiny* size cost for the ctor if were using pthreads but  for all other cases its no size cost. In all cases theres a significant  speedup in locking use. If the pthread ctor size cost is an issue we can  always add a conditionally compiled PdfMutexImpl_pthread.cpp but right  now it looks like a waste of time.- Apply tweaked patch by Mike Slegeir that adds appropriate mutural  exclusion to PdfFontCache to protect use of the fontconfig library  which is not thread-safe.- Make PdfEncodingFactory use direct static member PdfMutex not  pointer so leak checkers wont whine. We can do this because it looks like  all modern sane compilers do in fact handle the declaration of static members  with unknown size.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1137 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Make PdfMutex private to PoDoFo.This is necessary to avoid exposing <windows.h> <winsock2.h> etc to libraryusers including all their ugly macros freaky polymorphic behaviour dependingon definitions etc. To do it we need to use PdfMutex instances via pointerindirection.The only effect this has on public users is thatPdfMutex::IsPoDoFoMultiThread() cannot be called because PdfMutex isimplementation-private. A simple workaround for this will be to provide thesame function in public API elsewhere. We probably need a more generic way toget build info like this at runtime anyway. Ill look into that later butright now this fixes Win32 builds and helps reduce pollution of library usernamespace with unnecessary 3rd party header includes.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1126 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Introduce macros that handle printf format differences between Visual Studio andother compilers. The Visual Studio format used is known to be valid as far backas VS 6.Users of other compilers will get %lld and %llu for signed and unsigned long longintegers respectively. If your compiler doesnt like that please post about itto the mailing list mentioning:  - A suitable predefined macro to identify the compiler eg __GNUC__ _MSC_VER etc.  - What printf format strings it wants for signed and unsigned 64-bit typesI havent gone through and fixed the existing printf uses yet not least because someof them look like the code theyre in should be operating on 32-bit integers anyway.I suggest progressively fixing up usages as you touch code and will be doing the same.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1079 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Add CMake code to detect and define fixed-size integral types in a  cross-platform-and-version-and-compiler way (argh!)- Use CMake to detect header availability and use it rather than  platform macros like defined(_WIN32) to decide what headers to  includes. Need to go through the sources and eliminate all use of  defined(_WIN32) and the like in favour of function availablility  tests function compat wrappers etc.- Replace PDF_MIN and PDF_MAX macros with typesafe template versions  that force the caller to be specific about the desired return type  if theres a mismatch in the argument types. These versions also  prevent the double-evaluation problem with the classic min/max macros.- Begin moving platform-specific stuff to PdfCompilerCompat.{cpph}  to keep the cruft away from the code that does the real work.- Add podof_config.h generation to cmake move many command line definitions  into podofo_config.h for better visibility more readable compiler command  lines etc.- Add more common includes to pdfdefines- Begin removing reundant includes from other source files- Apply changes for Borland CC compatibility as desribed by Mirco Babin  with many changes/adjustments. Incomplete requires testing with Borland  and feedback.- This provides the groundwork to start cleaning up the use of integer types  in PoDoFo so its clear whats used where and why moving the platform-specific  stuff into isolated wrappers etc.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1070 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: If PODOFO_USE_UNORDERED_MAP is defined during compilation std::tr1::unordered_map will be used in PdfDictionary.I was curious after Craigs mail today wether using an unordered_map would make any difference in PoDoFo. Some benchmarking tests using callgrind have shownthat unordered_map is a little faster for writing and AddKeybut of course slower for GetKey and HasKey. As PdfDictionariesare usually very small the difference for GetKey and HasKey isnot very large and should therefore be rarely noticeable.By default this define is not set and std::map will be used.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@1039 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: A problem in PdfNamesTree GetKeyValue discovered by David Roach. See his description of the problem below:I just wanted to report a problem that I found in the GetKeyValue() methodof PdfNamesTree.  In the case where there is more then one array element inthe kids array of the Dest the code fails.  This is the case with the Sonydocument that I sent you last week.  This method is recursive and there is areturn in there to a recursive call to GetKeyValue().  If GetKeyValue()returns NULL the code as it stands will not check for the next arrayelement. git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@971 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Add support for finding and linking Lua 5.0 to FindLUA.cmake.  Unlike Lua 5.1 Lua 5.0 needs an extension library to work so we have to find that  too but must make sure NOT to link that extension library if were using lua 5.1 .  Tested with both Lua 5.1 and Lua 5.0 .- Add lua_compat.h header that handles a few small Lua 5.0 / Lua 5.1 API differences  that we care about ensures that LUA_VERSION_NUM is always defined and protects  the lua headers with `extern C .- Use a compat wrapper imp_lua_dofile around lua_dofile / luaL_dofile in planreader_lua.cpp  so we can link and run fine with both Lua 5.0 and Lua 5.1.- Remove annoing -wfloat-equal warning because its just noise in too many casesgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@953 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

podofoimpose: the Lua interpretor.There are a lot of things which will be rewritten if re-designed but it works.The default plan reader is still the native one since it would break my installation when I’ll upgrade. So you need to pass lua as last argument to podofoimpose in order to see it process your plan file written in Lua.Names of available constants are:PageCountSourceWidthSourceHeightYou’re required to provide (global vars in your scripts):PageWidthPageHeightAnd optionaly:ScaleThanks again to Craig Ringer. Various fixes while working with valgrind and callgrind.FIXED: podofoimgextract displays the correct number of successfully extracted images nowFIXED: S M A L L optimization in PdfObject the often called copy constructor creates       the copy itself instead of calling the assignment operator which results in several       1000 less calls to PdfVariant() and PdfVariant::Clear()FIXED: A memory leak in PdfStreamFIXED: Allocate TCIMapKey in PdfDictionary::Clear() only if the dictionary is not emptyI did lots of testing with valgrind today and was very happy to see that I was not able to detect a memory leak. The one found occurred only in the case of an exception and was easy to fix. Good job guys! :)git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@929 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: PdfReference is no immutable makes dirty flag handling code easierFIXED: PdfDocument::FixObjectReferences should now be a little faster (sorry no numbers)REMOVED: PdfMemDocument contained a copy of PdfDocument::FixObjectReferences this was removedFIXED: PdfDictionary and PdfArray (and therefore PdfVariant) have now real dirty flag handling.       You can call the non const version of PdfVariant::GetDictionary() and the dirty flag       will only be set if you modify the PdfDictionary.FIXED: A long planned change from myself: PdfArray is now a privated subclass of std::vector.       So you cannot call any stl vector functions directly anymore. I tried to add everything needed       to PdfArray. In case I missed something to get your application to work drop me an e-mail and       I will add the missing pieces.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@927 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: A dirty flag to PdfVariant which is set as soon as any non const member function is called.       This is currently necessary as PdfDictionary PdfArray etc. do not know if they have a parent       which could be informed about changes. If you rely on the IsDirty() and PdfParserObject::FreeObjectMemory       code you should case any PdfVariant to const PdfVariant before calling a Getter method so       that you are sured that IsDirty() will ever be set.FIXED: PdfInputDevice::Read returns now the correct number of bytes readgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@926 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

ADDED: Font subsetting based on code I got from ZhangYang (张杨.国际) half a year ago. Today I finally found time to integrate it in PoDoFo. It seems to work quite well. Maybe it is not a clean and pretty approach like the PdfTTFWriter I startet where I tried to model every table but this one seems to work and be much easier. So if it work out well I hope to removed PdfTTFWriter soon.Currently integration with the FontCache and PdfPainter is missing so it is not yet useful for creating documents. FIXED: Compilation of Unit-TestsREMOVED: setlocale hack was removed. Thanks for your comments Ulrich Craig and Leonard!This was indeed no good solution I marked the Print method for no so that it should no be used for floating point numbers as these might be affected by locale. Additionally I changed PdfVariant to convert doubles using ostringstream to a string which is then written using PdfOutputDevice::Write. It used PdfLocalImbue now. Currently there were no other places where floating point numbers where written to the Print method.It is still a TODO to change PdfOutputDevice to use some C++ solution instead of the C library calls. I am thinking of using boost::format optionally (if boost is available) as an alternative.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@866 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: PdfStreamedDocument should create correct XREF tables now. There were a semantic misunderstanding of mine in PdfOutputDevice. PdfOutputDevice::GetLength counts the bytes written to the device. If you seek back this wont be decreased. As a reason I added PdfOutputDevice::Tell which returns the current offset from the beginning of the file. Please make sure you use always the correct method. Most of the time Tell is the correct choice over GetLength.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@799 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

About a 1000-fold improvement in parsing speed for PDFs with sparse xref tablescontaining lots of free entries.  Because we always read the xref from low tohigh object number its guaranteed that the old free list management was theworst case - it prepended the free entry to a std::list then sorted the list.The sort was guaranteed to take near maximum time because of the reverse-orderentry at the start.Instead check if the reference is greater than all other entries in the freelist (this is a very cheap operation) and if so append it and skip the sort.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@791 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Dont attempt to construct a PdfContents from a NULL PdfObject.This is a bit of a hacky fix since users wont be expectingto get a null contents object from a page but its hard to be surehow to handle this better. We should probably construct the resourcesand contents objects lazily on first access if theyre null.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@790 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Sanity check the first object id and object count when reading xref subsections.Thisll stop us from trying to allocate too much memory if were reading a PDFwith an unknown xref size and somethings really wrong like theres a missingxref header and the first object entry is a pointer to a large offset in the file.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@789 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Use a vector instead of a mallocd block to manage the xref list when parsing.This allows us to more easily expand the list later which well need tosupport reconsructing an xref for a pdf with an invalid or missing /Size key inits trailer dictionary.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@787 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Greatly refactored the font system to allow custom encodings and later allow full unicode support in PoDoFo. Several APIs in the font subsystem will still be changed in the near future. PdfFontCID is heavily based on CID font code by ZhangYang. Width arrays and ToUnicode cmaps are still missing but will be added.PdfString will be removed in all APIs related to text output as PdfString is always in PdfDocEncoding or UTF16be which is not useful for drawing text into a PDF (or for extracting PDF from a PDF which should be possible with the new font system at the end).git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@769 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Rewrite of PdfContentsGraph and tests code to handle internal nodes with operators.The new implementation still needs some prettying up and debugging.- The tree its self now only contains operators/keywords not their arguments- Arguments are attributes on each node of the tree- Internal nodes may have arguments- Users no longer need to write a boost::variant visitor to work directly with the tree;  the nodes provide useful methods.- Its lots faster- ... and its still not handling all the testsCommiting anyway since the old code wasnt quite right either and nobodysrelying on this yet. There are still some operator stacking order issues to resolve.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@754 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Cleanups in contentsgraph (move more code into anon namespace; expose easy variant printer)- Futher improvements to ContentParser . Its a reasonably useful debugging tool.A known bug exists in this revision and previous ones where internal nodes like BMC witharguments are not touched in the right order; the open node gets hit before the arguments do.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@753 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Improve the content stream graph code:- Support operators like BMC/BDC which arent strict open/close pairs  (both are closed by the same EMC operator)- Handle operators that open a context and take arguments- Expose the operator info code to users of the class so they can do something  useful with the operator enum codes.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@741 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Introduce an OPTIONAL class that parses a content stream (as read fromPdfContentsTokenizer) and organizes it into a tree based on nesting of q/Qoperators etc. Its intended for use in PoDoFoBrowser and for content streamediting and manipulation.The actual internal list of known operators is presently tiny but it can round-tripstreams with unknown operators fine - they just wont affect the structure properly.Theyll still have any operands bound to them but if theyre a stateful/nested pairthat wont affect the tree structure correctly.This class uses the Boost Graph Library to do its job. It is exposed to users of theclass and it is intended that users directly manipulate the graph though the Boostgraph algorithms visitors etc. If Boost is not available the class is not builtand is preprocessed out of the headers.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@740 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Revert r728 - after more testing Im not at all satisfied its worth it or even effective. Looking at better implementations / options.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@729 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

On GCC 3.4 & above use the ::__gnu_cxx::__pool_alloc<T> allocator toautomatically pool allocations of TRefCountedBuffer objects. This is not aperformance win - in testing it shows little impact either way on real worldperformance. Again however itll help us reduce memory fragmentation withthis heavily used class.It is trivial to try different custom allocators or to disable the use of thecustom allocator.Other platforms and older versions of gcc continue to use std::allocator viaoperator new()s default behaviour.This change is binary incompatible but source compatible and existing userswont notice anything different.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@728 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Make PdfRefCountedBuffer use a 32 byte buffer in its internal shared bufferobject to store small strings.  Anything larger is automatically andtransparently copied to a new heap-allocated buffer. This does mean that wewaste 32 bytes for every big string - but on the other hand we save 8 bytes(on most platforms) of heap management overhead for every small string and thecost of the heap allocations/deallocations too. This change also serves toreduce memory fragmentation somewhat.This change tests OK here and doesnt affect the externally visible behaviorof PdfRefCountedBuffer at all.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@727 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Specifying -DPODOFO_BUILD_SHARED:BOOL=TRUE will now build only the shared library; specifying -DPODOFO_BUILD_STATIC:BOOL=TRUE will build only the static library specifying both will build both and specifying neither builds the static library only as a safe default.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@723 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

FIXED: Fixed PdfString semantics which were not clear in my opinion.       * PdfString contains now always the raw data in its buffer       * PdfString::IsHex() only tells if the string will be hex decoded on write out!       * PdfString::SetHexData() sets hex data which will be decoded and the raw data will be stored in the buffer       * PdfString::GetString() always returns the raw data now       * PdfString::operator<>== are much easier and faster now as they do not have to care for hex strings       * PdfString::GetLength() always returns the length of the internal buffer without terminating zeros!       * PdfStrings internal buffer is always terminated by 2 zeros (this is better than the case before where it was terminated by 1 zero if not unicode and by 2 zeros if it was a unicode string).PdfString should be more performant now and easier to use as GetLength always returns the length of the data and GetString always returns raw data and never hex decoded data.This might require some changes to user applications (PoDoFoBrowser most likely) but at the end PdfString will finally behave like you would expect a string class to behave.If requested a convinience method can be added that will convert the internal buffer to a std::string and return it (PdfString::ConvertToHex( std::string & rsBuffer ); ) git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@610 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

A large change: PdfDocument is now PdfMemDocument and both PdfMemDocument and PdfStreamedDocument implement the interface PdfDocument.PdfMemDocument allows access to the internal object structure and keeps everything in memory.PdfStreamedDocument was designed to not allow access to the internal object structure. It should be an easy to use class for only creating PDF files. It writes streams to disk (to an PdfOutputDevice) as soon as possible.The examples where changed to either create a PdfMemDocument or PdfStreamedDocument. All applications using PdfDocument have to be changed to eihter construct a PdfMemDocument or a PdfStreamedDocument as a PdfDocument cannot be constructed directly.The advantage is that all applications should be able to work with either PdfMemDocument or PdfStreamedDocument by using the PdfDocument interface without caring how the data is stored on disk!PdfElements have been change so that they all can be constructed from a PdfDocument. As a reason one can use PdfElements now all with both PdfDocument subclasses. All my tests passed so it seems nothing is broken by this large change :) git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@575 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Better fix for public exposure of fontconfig and freetype headers.We now forward declare the fontconfig and freetype types we use inPdf3rdPtyForwardDecl.h . Since there are typedefs used and the headers are`extern C we cant use a nice simple forward declaration. This keeps allthat cruft in one place.Headers that references freetype or fontconfig can now #includePdf3rdPtyForwardDecl.h and avoid exposing those libraries innards to userswho dont know or care about them.This should be extended to every other library we depend on; ideally anapplication should not require ANY addititional header search paths to usepodofos core functonality. If its not possible/practical to forward declarethe types the library uses we should consider keeping the problem header outof <podofo.h> and requiring its separate inclusion.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@553 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Even better - ensure that fontconfig usage is entirely invisible to PoDoFo API users.This does require a somewhat ugly void* usage in one method argument because FontConfiginsists on making FcConfig a typedef of FcConfig_ (so we cant properly forward declare it)but is relatively fuss free.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@552 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Include fontconfig as <fontconfig/fontconfig.h> and change detection accordingly.As most apps build systems will add the dir containing `fontconfig/fontconfig.hto their include path rather than just the dir directly containing fontconfig.hthis makes podofo a little easier to use in apps.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@551 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- The verbose timezone problem where strftime() returns a long format timezone like W. Australian Standard Time affects mingw not just VC++ so test for _WIN32 not _MSC_VER in PdfDate.cpp .- Disable -std=c++98 on win32 because mingw hides _timezone and _tzset() . First step in changing filters so that no exceptions can be thrown in destructors. This part only involves changing the way PdfStream and PdfPainter works.A page in PdfPainter has now to be finished with PdfPainter::FinishPage() and PdfStream::Append required now a BeginAppend and EndAppend. Setting filters on streams is now easier as filters can be passed to the Set and BeginAppend methods.More changes to come later.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@446 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Add -Wreorder to gcc warnings list- Remove -g3 . To get debug info set with -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=debug or  -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS=-g3 on the command line instead. With -g3 unconditionally  included in the definitions list people doing release builds (eg packagers)  have no way to turn off the generation of extended debug information.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@445 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Stop caching filters. Its nice not to have to worry about freeing them but  theyre usually short lived and confined to a single scope anyway. Theyre also  cheap to allocate and free. Filter caching poses problems now that we support  progressive filtering and would also be a problem for thread safety even  between multiple independent PdfDocument instances.  Instead we now return an auto_ptr<const PdfFilter> from the filter factory  allowing it to be naturally cleaned up at end of scope or assigned to a member  if it needs to be kept around for longer.  This patch is for consideration by the team and may be reverted later.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@422 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Updates to PdfFilter documentation- Alter protected API of PdfFilter to wrap the virtual methods in some sanity  checking code (very small). Most of this was done in the filter  implementation before but wrapping it makes sure it always happens and  provides some strong guarantees to filters. This removes a bunch of  repetitive error handling code from filter implementations and makes it  possible to avoid overriding BeginEncoding()/EndEncoding() at all for simple  filters like the hex filter.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@418 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Added initial support for streaming out PDFs directly to the disc. This feature is used by the LargeTest test program.Streaming out directly to disc is currently supported using PdfDocument and PdfImmediateWriter. Currently one can create broken documents very easy using this combination. A class PdfStreamedDocument will be added instead to support streaming out to disc. PdfDocument will be used for PDF file manipulations in memory and PdfStreamedDocument should be used for the sole purpose of creating new PDF files.PdfImage and PdfFont have yet to be adapted to make use of streaming. They still allocate memory for images and fonts which is not needed. Additionally the filters have to be modified to support streaming too. Documents created by PdfImmediateWriter are not compressed yet.My next step will be to create a useful public API for this feature using PdfStreamedDocument which wont allow to create broken PDFs.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@392 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Fixed several compiler warnings.Changed the generation number in a PdfReference to pdf_uint16 from unsigned long. This might save a few bytes for every object depending on the padding done by the compiler. The range of a generation number is defined to be 0-65535 so a 16bit unsigned integer is enough to store a generation number.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@359 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Large patch to refactor PoDoFos handling of XRef tables which was utterly broken.This patch first separates xref generation from writing the PDF file. PdfWriter is not responsible anymore for XRef generation. A new class PdfXRef handles this job now. This separation of concern will allow us to work more easily with problems in the XRef code.Additionally the XRef is build now when writing the XRef and not like before when writing thePdfObjects. This should fix issues when new free objects were added during loading of demand of objects during writing. This patch breaks linearization at the moment and XRef streams do not work correctly. As of nowI do not yet understand why XRef streams do not work. PoDoFo is able to read the create XRef streamsbut poppler and Acrobat Reader refuse to do so. I will fix this ASAP.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@358 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Added PdfInputStream:PdfInputStream is an interface which allows to read data from a data source. Current implementations are PdfMemoryInputStream PdfFileInputStream and PdfDeviceInputStream. A PdfOutputStream will be added too. PdfFilers Encode and Decode methods will be ported to use only input and output streams. This will be the first step to allow writing data immediately to a file. Additionally this will support to encode data step by step so that it is not always necessary to keep the complete data in memory.These interface is very simple as of now and I try to keep it as easy as possbile.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@337 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Craig was right! Moved all PdfFilter implementations to the new files PdfFiltersPrivate.h and PdfFiltersPrivate.cpp. As all filters are created using PdfFilterFactory the implementations should not be accessible in a public header file.Additionally added the virtual methods PdfFilter::CanEncode and PdfFilter::CanDecode which return wether a filter is able to encode or decode data. This was necessary as the RLE and LZW filter only decode data and are not able to encode data. Without this methods any user calling the encode methods of these filters will get an UnsupportedFilter exception without having any other way to check if encoding is possible with this filter.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@336 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Added a tokenizer for PDF file PdfTokenizer;Replaced PdfParserBase with PdfTokenizer;Simplified PdfVariant PdfParser and PdfParserObject as all datatypes are now read by PdfTokenizer::GetNextVariant() and comments are handled under the way;PdfTokenizer passes all tests but has still problems with some encrypted PDF files and I currently have a problem that PdfWriter creates invalid XRef tables. I am not yet sure wether this is related to the new PdfTokenizer or not;I am still commiting now knowing of the above two problems because PdfTokenizer makes the code a lot cleaner and is generally the better approach. We have now _ONE_ place where optimizations and bug fixes regarding reading of PdfObjects or datatypes can go.Additionally PdfTokenizer will also work for parsing PDF Content streams;I did not choose to use lex or flex for the lexing as all the code was basically there already. I just had to create a (hopefully) nice API for PdfTokenizer and port all the code and tests to the new classes.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@319 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

- Redesign delayed loading support in PdfVariant PdfObject & PdfParserObject to make delayed loading invisible to outside callers. Also intended to make it easier to use for users inheriting PdfVariant or PdfObject by detecting incorrect use of the delayed loading infrastructure. This infrastructure will be used to implement the delayed reading of user-supplied streams.- Add new build-time option PODOFO_EXTRA_CHECKS to do more expensive sanity checking. Used to control logic checking in the rewritten delayed loading code.- Enhance PdfInputDevice with indicators for errors and eof.- Fix a few misc typos warnings etc.- Add control over demand loading in ParserTest - use the -d argument (as FIRST argument) to enable it otherwise it defaults to off.- Restore POSIX unlink() under win32 in ObjectParserTest - it got lost accidentally as part of one of my prior commits. Allow ObjectParserTest to be built so that it crashes out on an exception instead of catching it - more useful for debugging. ObjectParserTest also now omits most of a stream of binary data when printing it to the console and it uses a method of writing temp files that works correctly with null values in the input. git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@310 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Coding style:  - Prefer late declaration     (Why: performance via late initialization avoiding unused locals)  - static arrays-of-const-type rather than static const pointers-to-const-type     (why: reduced runtime memory footprint hardware write protection)  - Prefer initialization over assignment    (why: performance and binary size)  - Use temporaries rather than locals where appropriate    (why: performance and binary size)These are all pretty uncontroversial so Im just checking this in. Yell if there are any disagreements or complaints. If there are no objections Ill be going through and updating code to follow these when I run into areas that need it.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@303 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Hi folksI just spent some time running valgrind over the PoDoFo tests andinvestigating the results. Being valgrind lots of time - its not fast.Anyway there are some out-of-bounds memory accesses happening inPdfParserObject that I think Ive corrected.The diff is attached. Since Im not at all familiar with the parser codeI wanted to run the patch by you folks before checking it in to ensureit looks sane. The tests still work (those that did before) and Impretty sure its right but Id still very much appreciate a quick look.This patch does NOT appear to affect the bug with figures parsed fromthe PDF 1.6 reference.With this patch applied the only remaining issues reported by valgrindwith the tests Im currently running are false positives in zlib.--Craig Ringergit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@259 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Patch by Craig Ringer:======================The attached patch alters PoDoFos pdf name escapingbehaviour to ensure that two names with the samemeaning always compare equal and to make it easier towork with names.    I wrote the bulk of this patch before the existing PDFname escaping support was committed to svn. Imsubmitting this because I think that support issomewhat incomplete - in particular two PdfNameobjects with the same meaning but escaped two differentways do not compare equal. Fixing this would require: - Unescaping both objects for each comparisonoperation; or - Unescaping every name object on creation then   re-escaping it in a standardised way       ... and since I already had this approach basicallydone I thought Id submit it instead.  PdfName is changed to use an unescaped internalrepresentation. When constructed it treats the inputstring as unescaped unless thePdfName::FromEscaped(...) calls are used to construct aPdfName object.        GetName() returns the unescaped name; a newGetEscapedName() is added to return the escaped namefor those uses who may need it. Write() is updated toescape its output. Caching of the escapedrepresentation might be desirable if a memory/cputrade-off proves worthwhile but this is not currentlydone.        In addition Ive switched PdfParserBase over to usethe IsWhiteSpace(...) and IsDelimeter(...) tests I usedin my older work. That change can easily be discardedif you dont like it but I found it a _lot_ faster.Comment by domseichter:=======================Thanks for your patch. I commited it to SVN.I am still thinking about what is the best solution for the PdfName problem. You are definitly right that the old way of storing the escaped version might cause problems. Therefore I commit your patch.The problem is though that storing the unescaped version is slower than storing the escaped version. On my system parsing the PDFReference16.pdf PDF file takes now an average of 26 seconds instead of 5 seconds before. This increase in parsing time is almost inacceptable. But an incorrectly working version is not better either.So I am trying to find a better and correctly working solution for this (most likely unescaping before comparison). I have to check wether this is faster or not.best regards Domgit-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@231 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

PdfError is now a std::exception. RAISE_ERROR throws now a PdfError object and SAFE_OP catches a PdfError object adds the current FILE and LINE to the callstack of the PdfError object and throws it again.Does anyone know if the many >try { x; } catch( PdfError & e ) { e.AddToCallStack(); throw e; }< blocks in the code cause a performance impackt? The other solution would be to have one try-catch block per function instead of the macros.The next step will be to remove all the PdfError return types. This will save us lots of init functions as most stuff can now be done in constructors as they can return now errors too. This will make a cleaner API for PoDoFo. Most likely it will take me sometime to complete these changes though as I am busy with exams right now.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@79 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Introducing PdfArray. Currently only a small wrapper around std::vector<PdfVariant>. More methods will be introduced later e.g. overloads for push_back and all datatypes like PdfString PdfName PdfDictionary ... . Also constructors and operators will be added. The TVariantList typedef is to be removed in the future. Methods for checking if a certain variant is contained in an array will be provided too.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@50 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287

Major refactoring of the source code. PdfVecObjects is now responsible to create new PdfObjects instead of PdfWriter.In the future we will have:PdfParser: Will create a PdfVecObjectsPdfWriter: Will write a PdfVecObjects to a PDF file on diskPdfDocument: Will allow the user to draw on a PdfVecObjects and easily modify an existing PDF file. Similar to what PdfSimpleWriter is now.git-svn-id: https://podofo.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/podofo/podofo/trunk@38 f068efa2-cb12-0410-9b19-e61e8c05d287
